definition: traditionally used as phonetic for ga/also pr. [ga1]/also pr. [qie2]

sentences.english: The president also harked back to ancient Sinhalese martial heroes.
sentences.chinese: 總統又提及古代僧伽羅戰爭英雄。

sentences.english: The Sangha of the Blessed One's disciples has practiced well.
sentences.chinese: 世尊的聲聞僧伽弟子行道正善。

sentences.english: This is the complection of Sinhalese.
sentences.chinese: 這是僧伽羅語的複雜性方面。

sentences.english: There is hardly any form of Sinhala literature which has not been fed by the well springs of jataka stories.
sentences.chinese: 僧伽羅文學作品幾乎都曾使用本生故事作爲素材。

sentences.english: And Master also has a lot of dynamic and educated young Sangha around Him.
sentences.chinese: 而師尊亦有很多活躍和受教育的青年僧伽在祂身邊。

sentences.english: The word Vesak itself is the Sinhalese language word for the Pali word "Visakha".
sentences.chinese: 衛塞節這個詞本身是巴利語的“衛塞迦”的僧伽羅語。

sentences.english: The Sangha of the Blessed One has entered on the good path;
sentences.chinese: 僧伽是世尊的追隨者，良好地修行佛法。

sentences.english: The word Sangha, on the external level, has two senses: conventional and ideal.
sentences.chinese: 僧伽一詞，在外在層次上有常規與理想兩種意義。
南傳上座部傳統的僧伽日。

sentences.english: However, not all members of the conventional Sangha are reliable models of behavior.
sentences.chinese: 然而，並非常規僧伽的所有成員都是可靠的行爲楷模。

sentences.english: Why did we make the World Buddhist Sangha Youth?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼我們創立世界佛教青年僧伽協會？

sentences.english: Several Sinhala kings are noted for driving back the Tamil invasions.
sentences.chinese: 若干位僧伽羅國王因擊退泰米爾人入侵而留名。

sentences.english: The Sangha of the Blessed One's disciples who have practiced well.
sentences.chinese: 世尊的聲聞僧伽弟子行道正善。

definition: Buddha (a person who has attained Buddhahood, or specifically Siddhartha Gautama)
arhat (Sanskrit)/a holy man who has left behind all earthly desires and concerns and attained nirvana (Buddhism)
Buddhist teacher (Sanskrit transliteration)/also written 阿闍黎|阿阇黎[a1 she2 li2]
Dharma (the teachings of the Buddha)/Buddhist doctrine
World Honored One/Revered One of the World (Buddha)
Hinayana, the Lesser Vehicle/Buddhism in India before the Mayahana sutras/also pr. [Xiao3 cheng2]
